CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: "Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and he comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of he city, a veritable goodwill ambassador...12. Bo has fun at the Loendi club"
TitMainTitle: Bill "Bojangles" Robinson making a face, seated at piano with woman, with another woman and two men looking on, in Loendi Club
